features: SILVERSEAL HYDROGEL dressings with X-Static Silver are used for the topical management of minor superficial wounds, minor lacerations, minor abrasions and minor first degree burns. These Silver first aid pads will not pull wound skin when removing.

SILVERSEAL SOOTHING sterile hydrogel pads are FDA cleared wound relief dressings, clinically proven to reduce scarring. The gel dressings provide immediate pain relief, and have been used to treat burns with no known adverse reactions for over a decade

SILVERSEAL MOISTURIZING hydrogel dressings aid in the removal of non-viable tissue from the wound by keeping a moist wound environment. No need to pre-wet for burn & wound protection. A wound dressing and moist burn pads suitable for the whole family

SILVERSEAL HEALING hydrogel based pads are sterile, latex-free and have the power of Silver for burns whether from open flame, hot water or radiation and give instant sunburn relief. These emergency burn gel pads are a must-have in your first aid kit

SILVERSEAL PROTECTIVE wound dressing pads with Silver coated fibers are applied directly to the wound, gel side down. A bandage or wrap should be used to keep the hydrogel wound dressing in place. The Silver dressing is designed for single use only. Made in the USA

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: SilverSeal Sterile Hydrogel Burn Patch Clincially Proven Relief for Burns and Scars Sterile hydrogel patch SilverSeal is clinically proven to reduce scarring and KILL 99% of STAPH, MRSA, and STREP.

Why choose our hydrogel products? SilverSeal 2x3 Add to Cart SilverSeal 4x4 Add to Cart Circles PLUS Aloe Add to Cart Hydrating Breast Mask Add to Cart Hexagels PLUS Aloe Add to Cart Customer Reviews 4.6 out of 5 stars 878 4.6 out of 5 stars 878 4.3 out of 5 stars 36 3.7 out of 5 stars 37 4.3 out of 5 stars 952 Price $18.99$18.99 $18.99$18.99 $35.99$35.99 $35.00$35.00 $28.99$28.99 Skin-Friendly ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔ Sterile ✔ ✔ ✘ ✘ ✘ Soothes and Protects ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔ Calms Skin Irritation ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔ Made of Purified Water ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔ Antimicrobial Silver Fibers ✔ ✔ ✘ ✘ ✘ Easy-To Use ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔ No Sticky Residue ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔
SilverSeal- The Future of Burn Care

What is a hydrogel? A hydrogel is basically a sheet of water. We take our proprietary, skin-friendly water-based, mix and run it through our powerful e-beam accelerator (powerful light) and create gel sheets - WITHOUT harsh chemicals- Creating hydrating hydrogels Does SilverSeal contain real silver? Yes! Each patch contains powerful X-static silver fibers that are suspended in the gel. We add this to each patch because of silver's antimicrobial properties. Are these patches sterile? Yes, each patch is sterile Will SilverSeal stick to my wounded skin? No, Silverseal will not stick to skin. You will need to secure each patch with a conventional bandage of your choosing to keep a secure hold. No adhesive means that your wound will heal without the fear of pulling new skin. (Ouch!). Is SilverSeal medical-grade? Yes, SilverSeal has been used in the hospital setting for over 20+ years and now Medagel is bringing this technology directly to you!

Benefits of Choosing a Medagel Product? Medical-grade, for your everyday! MEDAGEL's suite of unique medical-grade hydrogel products will be must-haves in your home. Making everyday aches, pains, and irritations a thing of the past with easy-to-use, safe, and skin-friendly products. What will be your medical "must-have" by MEDAGEL? What's a hydrogel? Hydrogels are gel-like, sheets of water that are primarily used for medical and cosmetic purposes. Made primarily of purified water, our gel is ultra-hydrating, skin-friendly, and instantly cooling.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Must Have For Burn Care
reviews.reviewText: I carry this in a medium sized first-aid kit on canoe trips.Unfortunately, it was needed to treat a second degree scald burn measuring 3-4 cm.After cleaning the wound, the dressing was changed every 4-5 days — care continued after the trip was over.Great healing result and provided comfort and protection especially while in the woods.Be aware this dressing has no way to adhere by itself. It must be held in place with a large bandage of some kind.I use occlusive film dressings such as Tegaderm with excellent results.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Helped a lot

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Love this helps heal the burn fast

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works amazingly well!! Wow!!
reviews.reviewText: I burnt the top of my forearm on the oven rack and it was absolutely a third degree burn. This product not only soothed my burn but it made it heal so much faster!! Amazing product! The only downfall is it kinda starts to put off this annoying smell the longer you have it on, in a matter of a day but you’re changing it by then so it’s not too bad. Other than that, very impressed!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Soft on the skin, helped reduce scarring
reviews.reviewText: This was good on a 3" second degree burn on my foot. Overkill, but more comfortable than just non stick pads.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Bandages are large and well sealed. Have not had to use them yet, thankfully. Added them to my First Aid kit.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewText: First time I used the gel dressing I like that it stick to the Wound when changing dressings Seems to work as well as the dry version.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works as intended!
reviews.reviewText: My first degree burn wasn't that severe but was ugly, red and aprox. 3 x 3in wide on my forearm. I wrapped the hydrogel pad with self-adhesive bandages for around five days and now it's week three and scarring is minimal and it healed great. Do recommend.
Wish this sort of bandage was still available at chemist’s
